greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Sum_{d|n} Kronecker(-6, d).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
formula: a(n) is multiplicative with a(2^e) = a(3^e) = 1, a(p^e) = e+1 if p == 1, 5, 7, 11 (mod 24), a(p^e) = (1 + (-1)^e)/2 if p == 13, 17, 19, 23 (mod 24).
Dirichlet g.f.: zeta(s) * L(chi,s) where chi(n) = Kronecker(-6, n). Sum_{n>0} a(n) / n^s = Product_{p prime} 1 / ((1 - p^-s) * (1 - Kronecker(-6, p) * p^-s)).
0 <= a(n) <= d(n) and these bounds are sharp. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Dec 14 2016
mathematica: a[ n_] := If[ n < 1, 0, Sum[ KroneckerSymbol[ -6, d], { d, Divisors[n]}]];
program: (PARI) a(n)=sumdivmult(n, d, kronecker(-6, d)) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Dec 14 2016
xref: Cf. A109017(n) = Kronecker(-6, n). - _Michael Somos_, Jul 22 2015
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Jun 22 2011
